alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Rockdale (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 4:15PM EST until December 31 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River near East Lithonia affecting DeKalb and Rockdale Counties. For the Yellow River Basin...including East Lithonia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Yellow River near East Lithonia. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Between 15 and 17 feet, Minor flooding continues and expands further into the woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Pleasant Hill Road. In Dekalb County, some flooding of backyards of homes begin on Harmony Hills Drive and Court. Johnson Creek flowing under Union Grove Road into the river begins to back up. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 13 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
